result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kewone Diajuain Brooks

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kewone Diajuain Brooks not in court, in custody.  Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court for Kewone Diajuain Brooks.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status/scheduling conference. Defense requests motion hearing date. State reply by 12-1-2022 and defense response on 12-15-2022. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Statements.

Defendant Kewone Diajuain Brooks not in court, in custody.  Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court for Kewone Diajuain Brooks.  Prosecuting attorney John J Rejowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status conference. Discovery received. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Court orders that any suppression motions or motions of that type due at the next court date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court, defendant Kewone Diajuain Brooks not in court, in custody.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kewone Diajuain Brooks in court by video with Attorney Craig Robert Johnson who appears in person.  Defendant Kewone Diajuain Brooks in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 18CF3089. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Davis. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Craig Robert Johnson in court by video, defendant Kewone Diajuain Brooks not in court, in custody.   Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Due to Court congestion Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kewone Diajuain Brooks not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Kesean McCullum and Kesean Pierce, Christian F., Joseph K.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $60,000.00 .  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. Defendant has a curfew from 6 pm to 7 am.  Defendant is to be in his house from 6 pm to 7 am.
  Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  Court ordered random drug testing.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kewone Diajuain Brooks in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Kewone Diajuain Brooks in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
